# SKReachConstraints

**Class**

A specification of the degree of freedom when solving inverse kinematics.

## Declaration

```swift
class SKReachConstraints
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKReachConstraints] object is used to describe the range of motion for an [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode] object whenever an inverse kinematic (IK) action is executed. To use reach constraints, create an [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKReachConstraints] object and assign it to a node’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/reachConstraints] property. For more information on using reach actions to perform IK animations, see the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKAction] class.

## Working with Reach Constraints

- **init(lowerAngleLimit:upperAngleLimit:)**: Initializes a new reach constraint object.
- **lowerAngleLimit**: The minimum angle that the node can have after it is rotated by a reach event.
- **upperAngleLimit**: The maximum angle that the node can have after it is rotated by a reach event.

## Constraints

- **SKConstraint**: A specification for constraining a node’s position or rotation.
